definition: commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already
to construct/to form/to make up/to compose/literary composition/paper mulberry (Broussonetia papyrifera)

sentences.english: The way to get recovery is to let business alone.
sentences.chinese: 復元的方法是要讓商業機構獨立。

sentences.english: In Wenzhou local commercial institutions generally have more representative power than the local government.
sentences.chinese: 在溫州，當地的商業機構一般比當地政府更有代表力。

sentences.english: So I'd say, the farther north you go, there's no businesses.
sentences.chinese: 所以我說，你越往北走，就越看不到商業機構了。

sentences.english: but there you actually have like a collection of all these businesses in one place.
sentences.chinese: 但是你又感覺這像一個商業機構的運營。

sentences.english: They also falsely claimed that this project was managed by a business organization.
sentences.chinese: 而且謊稱該計畫由商業機構管理。

sentences.english: A commercial establishment featuring rows of coin-operated games.
sentences.chinese: 以一排排投幣式遊戲機爲特徵的商業機構。

definition: public/publicly (owned, financed, operated etc)/run by the state
social movement/abbr. for 社會運動|社会运动
public utility/state-run enterprise/public foundation or enterprise, often charitable
